skill.name: email
skill.description:
Email operations skill for sending, fetching, and reading emails via IMAP/SMTP.
Uses curl with OpenSSL/LibreSSL for reliable TLS compatibility with Tencent Enterprise Mail and other providers.
Credentials are securely stored in macOS Keychain.

security_audit.summary: This email skill performs legitimate email operations using IMAP/SMTP protocols. Credentials are securely stored in macOS Keychain. No suspicious network endpoints or data exfiltration detected. The code behavior matches its stated purpose.

medium_findings.title: Email addresses stored in config file
medium_findings.description: The accounts.yaml configuration file contains email addresses (e.g., 'qihr2022@mail.sustech.edu.cn'). While these are public-facing identifiers and not sensitive credentials, storing them in plain text represents a minor privacy concern. Passwords are correctly stored in macOS Keychain.

content.user_title: Send and manage emails via IMAP/SMTP
content.value_statement: This skill enables sending, fetching, and reading emails directly through IMAP and SMTP protocols. It supports multiple email accounts with secure credential storage in macOS Keychain, making email automation simple and safe.
actual_capabilities: Send emails via SMTP with TLS encryption
Fetch email headers and lists from IMAP servers
Read full email content with MIME decoding
Secure credential storage via macOS Keychain
Filter and search emails using command-line tools
limitations: No attachment handling or download capability
No email filtering or server-side rules

use_cases.title: Automated email workflows
use_cases.description: Send meeting reminders, automate notifications, or forward important emails based on triggers

use_cases.title: Quick email composition
use_cases.description: Send emails without leaving your workflow. Just provide recipient, subject, and content

use_cases.title: Inbox monitoring
use_cases.description: Check recent emails, read specific messages, and search for keywords without opening a mail client

prompt_templates.title: Send basic email
prompt_templates.prompt: Send an email to [recipient] about [topic] with the message: [your message]

prompt_templates.title: Check inbox
prompt_templates.prompt: Check my email and show me the latest 5 messages

prompt_templates.title: Read specific email
prompt_templates.prompt: Read email #[number] and show me the full content

prompt_templates.title: Search emails
prompt_templates.prompt: Search my emails for messages about [keyword] and show me the results

output_examples.input: Send an email to team@example.com about the meeting tomorrow with the message: Hi team, the meeting is rescheduled to 3pm.

best_practices: Always verify recipient email addresses before sending important emails
Store passwords in macOS Keychain instead of configuration files
Use app-specific passwords provided by your email provider when available
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode passwords in any configuration files
Do not send emails without confirming the content with the user first
Do not access or read emails without explicit user permission

faq.question: Which email providers are supported?
faq.answer: Any provider with IMAP/SMTP access including Gmail, Outlook, Tencent Enterprise Mail, and other standard email services.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your email provider. Standard IMAP/SMTP protocols apply.

faq.question: Can I use this with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes, combine with calendar skills for automated reminders or with other tools to create email-based workflows.

faq.question: Are my credentials safe?
faq.answer: Yes, passwords are stored in macOS Keychain and never written to configuration files.

faq.question: Connection failing?
faq.answer: Check that IMAP/SMTP are enabled in your email settings and verify your credentials in Keychain.

faq.question: How does this compare to Gmail API?
faq.answer: This uses direct IMAP/SMTP protocols, offering broader compatibility but fewer features than OAuth-based APIs.
